title: A URI that includes a # does not send all URI information
body:
### Describe the bug

http://localserver/containers/container01#?mode=overwrite&signing=true

I am making a put request to my server using the URL above to create a container with id "container01#". Unfortunately, my server is not receiving the mode or signing variables needed to create the containers when a # is included in the URL. 

### Expected behavior

I was expecting my server to receive the mode and signing variables regardless of if a # is included in the URL. 

### Actual behavior

The mode and signing variables are not sent to my server and only "http://localserver/containers/container01" is received by the server. 

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

If this is a feature that I am unaware of, I would appreciate some input on how to work around this issue so that my server can receive the whole URL including the #.
